rev.comment: The legallity of the currency is an extremelly important issue, but the information added is not backed by any reference at all (the refs included don't even mention the issues)
rev.diff:
Line 157: Line 157:
A bitcoin account can be compromised if a wallet file is left unprotected. Malware specificaly designed to steal bitcoin wallets was discovered.<ref>http://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2011/06/bitcoin-malware/</ref><ref>http://www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/all-your-bitcoins-are-ours</ref><ref>http://www.symantec.com/security_response/writeup.jsp?docid=2011-061615-3651-99</ref><ref>http://www.f-secure.com/weblog/archives/00002187.html</ref>

===Legality===
  â
The US Senate is set to meet on possible regulation regarding BitCoins and their legality under U.S. tax code. The Senate is set to rule on possibly prosecuting BitCoin miners under the RICO (Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act) laws. <ref>http://www.benzinga.com/economics/11/06/1179842/bitcoin-too-good-to-be-true</ref> <ref>http://www.tribbleagency.com/?p=8070</ref>
